newsitem.title: USA: AT&T's WorldNet offers America Online.
newsitem.headline: AT&T's WorldNet offers America Online.

text.p: AT&T Corp. said Monday it would offer access to America Online Inc., the world's most popular consumer online service, on its WorldNet service.
AT&T said the service will cost 20 percent less than if customers use the telecommunication giant's standard dial-up access rate.

AT&T WorldNet customers will receive 15 hours of free usage under America Online's one-month trial offer and can download the registration software by clicking on links from the AT&T WorldNet "At Home" page, the company said.
America Online provides a e-mail, online communities, chat content and original programming for interactive communities.
AT&T WorldNet Service provides value-added access to the Internet, including access to online service providers such as America Online.
The service is available for $7.95 per month for five hours plus $2.35 for each additional hour, or $15.95 per month for 20 hours plus $2.35 for each additional hour.
AT&T's stock fell $1.125 to $53.50 on the New York Stock Exchange. America Online lost 50 cents to $31.125.
